RECORDS.label: mac
RECORDS.tooltip: W5100 ethernet shield mac adress

RECORDS.label: maxMQTTretry
RECORDS.tooltip: set minimum quality of signal so it ignores AP's under that quality

RECORDS.label: ip
RECORDS.tooltip: IP adress

RECORDS.label: gateway
RECORDS.tooltip: Gateway

RECORDS.label: Dns
RECORDS.tooltip: DNS server

RECORDS.label: subnet
RECORDS.tooltip: Subnet mask

RECORDS.label: jsonPublishing
RECORDS.tooltip:
FALSE if you don't want to use Json publishing (one topic for all the parameters)
example home/OpenMQTTGateway_ESP32_DEVKIT/BTtoMQTT/4XXXXXXXXXX4 {"rssi":-63,"servicedata":"fe0000000000000000000000000000000000000000"}

RECORDS.label: jsonReceiving
RECORDS.tooltip: FALSE if you don't want to use Json  reception analysis

RECORDS.label: simplePublishing
RECORDS.tooltip:
TRUE if you don't want to use simple publishing (one topic for one parameter)
example
home/OpenMQTTGateway_ESP32_DEVKIT/BTtoMQTT/4XXXXXXXXXX4/rssi -63.0
home/OpenMQTTGateway_ESP32_DEVKIT/BTtoMQTT/4XXXXXXXXXX4/servicedata fe0000000000000000000000000000000000000000

RECORDS.label: simpleReceiving
RECORDS.tooltip: FALSE if you don't want to use old way reception analysis

RECORDS.label: subjectMQTTtoX
RECORDS.tooltip: MQTT subject listened by the gateway to execute commands (send RF, IR or others)

RECORDS.label: subjectMultiGTWKey
RECORDS.tooltip: MQTT subject listened by the gateway to execute commands (send RF, IR or others)

RECORDS.label: subjectGTWSendKey
RECORDS.tooltip: MQTT subject listened by the gateway to execute commands (send RF, IR or others)

RECORDS.label: time_avoid_duplicate
RECORDS.tooltip: if you want to avoid duplicate mqtt message received set this to > 0, the value is the time in milliseconds during which we don't publish duplicates

RECORDS.label: TimeBetweenReadingSYS
RECORDS.tooltip: time between system readings (like memory)

RECORDS.label: bigmem_board_JSON_MSG_BUFFER
RECORDS.tooltip: Json message max buffer size, don't put 1024 or higher it is causing unexpected behaviour on ESP8266

RECORDS.label: smallmem_board_JSON_MSG_BUFFER
RECORDS.tooltip: Json message max buffer size, don't put 1024 or higher it is causing unexpected behaviour on ESP8266

RECORDS.label: RF_RECEIVER_PIN
RECORDS.tooltip: 1 = D3 on mega

RECORDS.label: RF_RECEIVER_PIN
RECORDS.tooltip: D27 on DOIT ESP32

RECORDS.label: RF_EMITTER_PIN
RECORDS.tooltip: D12 on DOIT ESP32

RECORDS.label: IR Led emitter pin
RECORDS.tooltip: D0/ replace by 0 (D3) if you use IR LOLIN controller shield /replace by 5 with sonoff rf bridge

RECORDS.label: IR receiver pin
RECORDS.tooltip: D4 /replace by 4 with sonoff rf bridge

RECORDS.label: subjectGTWIRtoMQTT
RECORDS.tooltip: IR MQTT Subjects

RECORDS.label: subjectIRtoMQTT
RECORDS.tooltip: IR MQTT Subjects

RECORDS.label: subjectMQTTtoIR
RECORDS.tooltip: IR MQTT Subjects

RECORDS.label: IRbitsKey
RECORDS.tooltip: bits  will be defined if a subject contains IRbitsKey followed by a value of 2 digits

RECORDS.label: IRRptKey
RECORDS.tooltip: repeats  will be defined if a subject contains IRRptKey followed by a value of 1 digit

RECORDS.label: repeatIRwMQTT
RECORDS.tooltip: do we repeat a received signal by using mqtt

RECORDS.label: Time Between Reading DHT
RECORDS.tooltip: time between 2 DHT readings

RECORDS.label: DHT_RECEIVER_PIN
RECORDS.tooltip: 5 = D1 you can put 14 = D5 if you don't use HCSR501 sensor and the RFM69

RECORDS.label: dht_always
RECORDS.tooltip: if false when the current value for temp or hum is the same as previous one don't send it by MQTT

RECORDS.label: repeatIRwNumber
RECORDS.tooltip: default repeat of the signal

RECORDS.label: RawDirectForward
RECORDS.tooltip: direct repeat of IR signal with raw data

RECORDS.label: DumpMode
RECORDS.tooltip: FALSE so as to see big dumps of IR codes

RECORDS.label: pubIRunknownPrtcl
RECORDS.tooltip: key to avoid mqtt publication of unknown IR protocol (set to true if you want to publish unknown protocol)

RECORDS.label: PanasonicAddress
RECORDS.tooltip: Panasonic address (Pre data)

RECORDS.label: IR_RECEIVER_PIN
RECORDS.tooltip: 2 = D2 on mega

RECORDS.label: IR_RECEIVER_PIN
RECORDS.tooltip: 0 = D2 on arduino

RECORDS.label: RF_RECEIVER_PIN
RECORDS.tooltip: D3 on nodemcu // put 4 with rf bridge direct mod

RECORDS.label: RF_EMITTER_PIN
RECORDS.tooltip: RX on nodemcu if it doesn't work with 3, try with 4 (D2) // put 5 with rf bridge direct mod

RECORDS.label: RF_RECEIVER_PIN
RECORDS.tooltip: 1 = D3 on arduino

RECORDS.label: RF_EMITTER_PIN
RECORDS.tooltip: 4 = D4 on arduino

RECORDS.label: RFprotocolKey
RECORDS.tooltip: protocol will be defined if a subject contains RFprotocolKey followed by a value of 1 digit

RECORDS.label: RFbitsKey
RECORDS.tooltip: bits  will be defined if a subject contains RFbitsKey followed by a value of 2 digits

RECORDS.label: repeatRFwMQTT
RECORDS.tooltip: do we repeat a received signal by using mqtt with RF gateway

RECORDS.label: RFpulselengthKey
RECORDS.tooltip: pulselength will be defined if a subject contains RFprotocolKey followed by a value of 3 digits

RECORDS.label: subjectMultiGTWRF
RECORDS.tooltip: subject monitored to listen traffic processed by other gateways to store data and avoid ntuple

RECORDS.label: RF_EMITTER_REPEAT
RECORDS.tooltip: RF number of signal repetition - Can be overridden by specifying "repeat" in a JSON message.

RECORDS.label: RF2codeKey
RECORDS.tooltip: code will be defined if a subject contains RF2codeKey followed by a value of 7 digits

RECORDS.label: RF2periodKey
RECORDS.tooltip: period  will be defined if a subject contains RF2periodKey followed by a value of 3 digits

RECORDS.label: RF2unitKey
RECORDS.tooltip: number of your unit value  will be defined if a subject contains RF2unitKey followed by a value of 1-2 digits

RECORDS.label: RF2groupKey
RECORDS.tooltip: number of your group value  will be defined if a subject contains RF2groupKey followed by a value of 1 digit

RECORDS.label: RF2dimKey
RECORDS.tooltip: number of your dim value will be defined if a subject contains RF2dimKey and the payload contains the dim value as digits

RECORDS.label: repeatPilightwMQTT
RECORDS.tooltip: do we repeat a received signal by using mqtt with Pilight gateway

RECORDS.label: RF315_EMITTER_PIN
RECORDS.tooltip: On arduino UNO connect IR emitter pin to D9 , comment #define IR_USE_TIMER2 and uncomment #define IR_USE_TIMER1 on library <library>IRremote/IRremoteInt.h so as to free pin D3 for RF RECEIVER PIN

RECORDS.label: _2G_TX_PIN
RECORDS.tooltip: D6 to A6 RX,

RECORDS.label: RawFrequency
RECORDS.tooltip: raw frequency sending

RECORDS.label: _2G_RX_PIN
RECORDS.tooltip: D7 to A6 TX

RECORDS.label: _2G_PWR_PIN
RECORDS.tooltip: onnect a MOSFET to power on and off your A6/7 module

RECORDS.label: _2G_TX_PIN
RECORDS.tooltip: D16 to A6 RX,

RECORDS.label: _2G_RX_PIN
RECORDS.tooltip: D17 to A6 TX

RECORDS.label: _2G_PWR_PIN
RECORDS.tooltip: connect a MOSFET to power on and off your A6/7 module

RECORDS.label: _2G_TX_PIN
RECORDS.tooltip: D6 to A6 RX,

RECORDS.label: _2G_RX_PIN
RECORDS.tooltip: D7 to A6 TX

RECORDS.label: _2G_PWR_PIN
RECORDS.tooltip: connect a MOSFET to power on and off your A6/7 module

RECORDS.label: _2GPhoneKey
RECORDS.tooltip: phone number define the phone number to send the SMS MQTT->2G

RECORDS.label: ADC_PIN (Analog)
RECORDS.tooltip: on nodeMCU this is D3 GPIO0

RECORDS.label: TimeBetweenReadingADC
RECORDS.tooltip: time between 2 ADC readings, minimum 200 to let the time of the ESP to keep the

RECORDS.label: ThresholdReadingADC
RECORDS.tooltip: following the comparison between the previous value and the current one +- the threshold the value will be published or not

RECORDS.label: bh1750_always
RECORDS.tooltip: if false when the current value for light Level (Lux) is the same as previous one don't send it by MQTT

RECORDS.label: Light Sensor I2C Address
RECORDS.tooltip: Light Sensor I2C Address

RECORDS.label: TimeBtw_Read
RECORDS.tooltip: define the time between 2 scans

RECORDS.label: Scan_duration
RECORDS.tooltip: define the time for a scan

RECORDS.label: HM-10 (blank value)
RECORDS.tooltip: Hide HM-11 if you use this

RECORDS.label: HM-11 (blank value)
RECORDS.tooltip: Hide HM-10 if you use this

RECORDS.label: HM_BLUE_LED_STOP
RECORDS.tooltip: false to stop the blue led light of HM1X

RECORDS.label: pubBLEServiceData
RECORDS.tooltip: false if if you don't want to publish service data (in case you are having too heavy

RECORDS.label: subjectHomePresence
RECORDS.tooltip: will send Home Assistant room presence message to this topic (first part is same for all rooms, second is room name)

RECORDS.label: GPIOInputDebounceDelay
RECORDS.tooltip: debounce time, increase if there are issues

RECORDS.label: GPIOKeyCodeDebounceDelay
RECORDS.tooltip: debounce time, increase if there are issues

RECORDS.label: TimeBetweenReadingINA226
RECORDS.tooltip: time between 2 INA226 readings
the same on all nodes that talk to each other
set to 'true' if you are using an RFM69HCW module
How many times to send the message
Interval between sendings in ms
Interval between recieving in ms (avoid debouncing)
if false only send current value if it has changed
